content_html:
As much as we may dream about weddings, from our own to the ceremonies of others, the actual days leading up to said events can be a stressful shit-storm for everyone involved. Preparing for these momentous occasions is like chipping away at a Rubik's cube — with gifts making up an entire side of the colorful puzzle. Whether you need to strategize your own registry or plot the perfect present for another couple, coming up with the right gifting material isn't always a piece of [over-priced wedding] cake. So, to simplify the process, we went straight to the been-there-done-that hitched sources for their most experienced-giftee opinions.
We rounded up 18 wedding gifts that women not only received IRL but the ones they actually adored and still use to this day — tried-and-true registry classics that have stood the test of time AND wild-card guest surprises, too. We'll save you one side of that wedding-prep Rubik's cube struggle with the approved ideas ahead: there's everything from first-class flight upgrades to unique ceramic dinnerware sets and even a fire-engine red fro-yo machine. Be sure to share the unwrapped favorites from your own big day in our form below for a chance to be featured in the story.
Submit your best wedding gifts, here.
At Refinery29, we’re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff. All of our market picks are independently selected and curated by the editorial team. If you buy something we link to on our site, Refinery29 may earn commission.

Carry-On Suitcase Set



Jessica, 28

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose It: "Perfect for our honeymoon and all of our future travels!"

First-Class Flight Upgrade



Jessica, 28

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "Our best man and his girlfriend surprised us with flight upgrades. Considering we flew to South Africa, it was such a thoughtful gift."

Framed Wedding Invitation



Julia, 33

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "[Gifted by] my husband's father's cousins, which was very unexpected but it is truly my most cherished gift. It’s hanging in our bedroom and brings me joy every day when I look at it. "

R29 suggests Framebridge for professional framing services.

Ceramic Dinnerware Set



Carolyna, 31

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose It: "Love the minimalist design, mix-n-match nature of the sets, and the durability."

Cash



DG, 33

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "Multiple guests provided cash and it was great because we were so broke after the wedding!"

Cotton-Percale Sheet Set



Olivia, 31

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose It: "Because I sleep on them!"

Diptyque Candle



Olivia, 31

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "[Gifted by] one of my best friends/bridesmaids — I love the candle and would never buy the large size for myself, but it's a fun decorative piece and you can reuse the container as a vase or for kitchen tools."

A Bottle Of Wine Every Month



Cara, 33

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "My bridal party chipped in and got us a 6-month wine club subscription. Each month we get a really nice bottle of wine which is a something we wouldn't normally spend on ourselves. When they gifted it to me, they each wrote a note on a DIY wine glass-shaped card that said 'cheers!' the whole thing was so thoughtful."

White Serving Bowls



Alison, 31

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose It: "It was part of set of all my plates. I like how simple they are and they work well for serving at parties."

Ice Cream & Fro-Yo Machine



Alison, 31

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "[Gifted by] Mandy Mitchell, one of my best friends and a bridesmaid at my wedding — anyone who knows me knows I love ice cream."

Zola's Airbnb Gift Card



Zoe, 29

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose it: "When you get cash for your wedding it's easy to just throw it into your bank account and not bookmark it for the thing you actually wanted to use it for. With these Airbnb gift cards we were essentially forcing ourselves to use that money for a trip and now we associate that trip with the people who bought us the gifts."

Wedding Photo Book



Zoe, 29

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "My best friend and I got married in the same year and decided to get each other sentimental presents instead of trading expensive gifts. She asked our closest friends and family to send her pictures and stories about us and then created a photo book for us. Much more personal than a silverware set!"

Sex-Toy Kit



Salky, 43

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "As we handed around the gifts for everyone to look at, as we had with all the other appropriate gifts, my then 80 year old father-in-law saw the piña colada flavored lube and took a big swig from the bottle. We had to pry the bottle out of his hand because he wanted more! He didn't know it was lube."

Champagne Glasses



Kristyn, 29

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose it: "There are a few different shapes/styles to choose from and I knew exactly what I wanted!"

Smart Device Controller Hub



Kristyn, 29

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "[Gifted by] my old boss and now very good friend Eric—him and his wife knew I had an Alexa and knew I wanted to automate my home, but didn't think I had the budget for it. This allows you to connect Alexa to other smart devices and it works great!!! Didn't even know I needed it but now i use it every day!!!"

Wooden Serving Bowl



DG, 33

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose it: "My wife and I use it together weekly and it looks great in our kitchen."

Dutch Oven



Olivia, 26

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Chose it: "It was one of the few things from our registry that I would likely never buy for myself because of cost. I knew that it would be a beautiful piece that would stand the test of time—it still looks amazing three years later! Oh, and it’s also the best pot in the world."

Stand Mixer



Olivia, 26

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "My mother-in-law bought it for us. She uses it all the time because she loves baking. I didn’t think I’d use it much but since receiving it I have seen how much easier it makes life in the kitchen! It’s also nice to be able to easily replicate some of her amazing desserts for myself!"

A Really Good Knife Set



Melissa, 39

Gift Type: Registry

Why She Loves It: "I got married (for the first time) in 2005 and this is one of the only items from the registry that I still own. Everything else I either gave away or who knows where it went. The J.A. Henckels knife set that I own is still sharp and I use them almost every day for cooking or just chopping up veggies. This is something I'll have for life."

Video Montage



Emily, 28

Gift Type: Surprise

Why She Loves It: "Probably the video montage my best friend made."

Story from Weddings

20 Wedding Gifts Real Women Actually Used — From Registry To Surprise

Elizabeth Buxton
Photographed by Ted Cavanaugh.
As much as we may dream about weddings, from our own to the ceremonies of others, the actual days leading up to said events can be a stressful shit-storm for everyone involved. Preparing for these momentous occasions is like chipping away at a Rubik's cube — with gifts making up an entire side of the colorful puzzle. Whether you need to strategize your own registry or plot the perfect present for another couple, coming up with the right gifting material isn't always a piece of [over-priced wedding] cake. So, to simplify the process, we went straight to the been-there-done-that hitched sources for their most experienced-giftee opinions.

We rounded up 18 wedding gifts that women not only received IRL but the ones they actually adored and still use to this day — tried-and-true registry classics that have stood the test of time AND wild-card guest surprises, too. We'll save you one side of that wedding-prep Rubik's cube struggle with the approved ideas ahead: there's everything from first-class flight upgrades to unique ceramic dinnerware sets and even a fire-engine red fro-yo machine. Be sure to share the unwrapped favorites from your own big day in our form below for a chance to be featured in the story.

title: 20 Wedding Gifts Real Women Actually Used — From Registry To Surprise

As much as we may dream about  weddings  , from our own to the ceremonies of others, the actual days leading up to said events can be a stressful shit-storm for  everyone   involved. Preparing for these momentous occasions is like chipping away at a Rubik's cube — with  gifts   making up an entire side of the colorful puzzle. Whether you need to  strategize your own registry   or plot the  perfect present   for another couple, coming up with the right gifting material isn't always a piece of [over-priced wedding] cake. So, to simplify the process, we went straight to the been-there-done-that hitched sources for their most experienced-giftee opinions.  We rounded up 18  wedding   gifts that women not only received IRL but the ones they actually adored and still use to this day — tried-and-true registry classics that have stood the test of time AND wild-card guest surprises, too. We'll save you one side of that wedding-prep Rubik's cube struggle with the approved ideas ahead: there's everything from first-class flight upgrades to unique ceramic dinnerware sets and even a fire-engine red fro-yo machine. Be sure to share the unwrapped favorites from your own big day in our form below for a chance to be featured in the story.  Submit your best wedding gifts,    here  .   At Refinery29, we’re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff. All of our market picks are independently selected and curated by the editorial team. If you buy something we link to on our site, Refinery29 may earn commission.   Carry-On Suitcase Set

It’s hanging in our bedroom and brings me joy every day when I look at it. "   R29 suggests  Framebridge   for professional framing services.  Ceramic Dinnerware Set

title_html: 20 Wedding Gifts Real Women Actually Used — From Registry To Surprise
